abstract.p: Five advertising spots are nominated for Emmy Award for outstanding television commercial in annual competition sponsored by Academy of Television Arts and Sciences (S)

block.p: Five spots have been nominated for an Emmy Award for outstanding television commercial in the annual competition sponsored by the Academy of Television Arts and Sciences. The winner will be announced next month during the presentation of the 52nd annual Emmy Awards.

The nominees are: ''Action Figures,'' a humorous look at a shipping mixup, by the New York office of BBDO Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group, for the FedEx Corporation; ''Whassup True,'' the initial spot in the popular series of ''Whassup'' beer commercials, by the Chicago office of DDB Worldwide, also part of Omnicom, for the Budweiser brand sold by Anheuser-Busch; and ''Cat Herders,'' an elaborate Super Bowl commercial for Electronic Data Systems by Fallon Minneapolis, part of the Fallon Worldwide unit of Publicis S.A.

Five spots have been nominated for an Emmy Award for outstanding television commercial in the annual competition sponsored by the Academy of Television Arts and Sciences. The winner will be announced next month during the presentation of the 52nd annual Emmy Awards.

The nominees are: ''Action Figures,'' a humorous look at a shipping mixup, by the New York office of BBDO Worldwide, part of the Omnicom Group, for the FedEx Corporation; ''Whassup True,'' the initial spot in the popular series of ''Whassup'' beer commercials, by the Chicago office of DDB Worldwide, also part of Omnicom, for the Budweiser brand sold by Anheuser-Busch; and ''Cat Herders,'' an elaborate Super Bowl commercial for Electronic Data Systems by Fallon Minneapolis, part of the Fallon Worldwide unit of Publicis S.A.

Also: ''Let's Light This Candle,'' the initial spot in the popular series of commercials for Ameritrade featuring a slacker character named Stuart, created by the Chicago office of Ogilvy One Worldwide, part of the Ogilvy & Mather unit of the WPP Group; and ''The Morning After,'' a humorous look at New Year's Day 2000, created by Wieden & Kennedy in Portland, Ore., for Nike.
